text: in the rubble of a huge bomb blast
candles prayers and tears the so-called
Islamic state sent the lorry packed with
explosives into the heart of Baghdad
when the streets were full of people
celebrating the Eid festival during the
holy month of Ramadan
this man says most people who died were
in their twenties he says the Iraqi
government just sits there doing nothing
to improve the security among the young
victims are popular dancer who was
gaining international recognition Adel
el JAF known as Al Jarreau narrowly
survived previous bombings and had
described his own country as a storm of
destruction as they try to erase the
visual reminders of what happened in
Baghdad over the weekend people are once
again furious with the government it has
ordered new security measures for
Baghdad including getting these bomb
detectors off the streets why they're
still being used that checkpoints is
baffling five years ago the BBC found
out that they were fake and served no
purpose whatsoever people who fled the
city of Fallujah are also desperate for
help the government recently celebrated
retaking the city from the jihadists
which prompted the so called Islamic
state to bomb Baghdad for those
displaced from Fallujah it's been a
painful Ramadan this video that's on why
you made you how can I celebrate Eid
away from my city asked mama we the
people of Fallujah have been humiliated
as the victims of the bomb blast are
buried there'll be a lot of talk in the
UK this week about the Chilcott report
and why Britain invaded back in 2003
expect to hear about that search for
WMDs since then many different weapons
of mass destruction have been causing
